whereiation 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Reference

Plots

Visualize variation in the dependent variable or representation

plot_deltas()

Visualize difference from avg. by factor (lollipop)

plot_expected_proportions()

Visualize variation between the expected & actual percentages

plot_group_split()

Visualize variation between two groups

plot_spread() plot_spread_single_obs() plot_spread_interactive()

Visualize spread of avg. values among all factors for all variables

Data Summaries

There are some helper functions to prepare data frames for use with plots

summarize_factor_extremes()

Identify the factors with the most extreme averages for each field

summarize_factors_all_fields()

Calculate the importance of ALL factors in a ALL fields

Other

Functions that do something else or in-progress

profile_n()

Profile observations with the most extreme values

refactor_columns()

Convert all fields to factors (same method as under plots)

Data

Built-in data sets

employee_attrition

Employee Attrition (IBM Watson)

Contents
